full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/28/2023 30. Are you entitled to return to country of issuance of your passport Yes No Travel document Yes No Or other document Yes No (If not. explain why) No, I do not have any travel document. 31. What do you think would happen to you if you returned? (Explain) One of the reasons why I came out from Nicaragua during the civil war was the fear that I began to feel of what could happen to me, because I occupied public positions during the government of Somoza. 32. When you left your home country, to what country did you intend to go? To the nearest one, and this was Honduras. 33. Would you return to your home country? Yes No (Explain) No, first of all because I am an old man, who could not resist any bad treatment and secondly I have all of my children in this country, I can not return to Nicaragua. 34. Have you or any member of your immediate family ever belonged to any organization in your home country Yes No. (If yes. provide the following information relating to each organization: Name of organization. dates of membership or affiliation. purpose of the organization. what, if any, were your official duties or responsibilities. and are you still an active member (If not. explain) I always was a member of the PLN, the Party of the Government. 35. Have you taken any action that you believe will result in persecution in your home country? Yes No (If yes, explain) I do not if they can consider this like an action, but just the fact that I was Major of the city of Somoto and Local Judge of Somoto, is enough for them to consider me an enemy of their process. 36. Have you ever been detained interrogated convicted and sentenced imprisoned in any country? Yes No (If yes, specify for each instance: what occurred and the circumstances. dates, location. duration of the detention or imprisonment. reason for the detention or conviction, what formal charges were placed against you. reason for the release, names and addresses of persons who could verify these statements. Attach documents referring to these incidents, if any). They did not have time, I left the country on July 17, 1979 and they entered on July 19,1979. 37. If you base your claim for asylum on current conditions in your country, do these conditions affect your freedom more than the rest of that country's population? Yes No (If yes, explain) Yes, because of my militancy with the former government and not for the last years, butsince my youth, because I was a man that always served to the Liberal Party. 38. Have you, or any member of your immediate family. ever been mistreated by the authorities of your home country/country of nationality Yes No. If yes. was it mistreatment because of Race Religion Nationality Political opinion or Membership of a particular social group? Specify for each instance: what occurred and the circumstances. date, exact location. who took such action against you and what was his/her position in the government. reason why the incident occurred, names and addresses of people who witnessed these actions and who could verify these statements. Attach documents referring to these incidents. Because we left the country, as soon as we could, in order to avoid any bad treatment or ha- rassment. 39. After leaving your home country, have you traveled through (other than in transit) or resided in any other country before entering the U.S.? Yes No (If yes. identify each country, length of stay, purpose of stay, address, and reason for leaving. and whether you are entitled to return to that country for residence purposes. Yes, I arrived to Honduras with a big fear, I remained there until 1982, time when the Sandi- nist began to infiltrated the towns of Honduras looking and persecuting nicaraguan people. was scared and that made me got sick, SO what I did was to try to get a Hondurian passport and it was what I did in order to get out from there and come to this country. 40. Why did you continue traveling to the U.S.? N/A 41. Did you apply for asylum in any other country? Yes-Give details No-Explain why not No, but I got a temporary residence in Honduras SO that I could get passport. (3) (over)
